required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Granisetron on Usage of Sympathomimetics During Caesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Granisetron on Usage of Sympathomimetics During Caesarean Section - a Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study is to quantify the dose and usage of sympathomimetics used in caesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock:
Recent metaanalysis showed significantly reduced hypotension and bradycardia in patients undergoing caesarean section in spinal anesthesia when 5-hydroxytryptamine 3 receptor antagonists were used prophylactically.
Due to this fact in our clinic the standard procedure was changed. All patients for caesarean section receive Granisetron before spinal anesthesia.
The aim of the present study is to evaluate the usage and dose of sympathomimetics during spinal anesthesia.
Therefore the investigators will evaluate approximately 120 participants who received granisetron and 120 participants who did not receive 5-hydroxytryptamine 3 receptor antagonists.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes starting with induction of spinal anesthesia.
primary_outcome.description: Type of sympathomimetics during during the operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes starting with induction of spinal anesthesia.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative dose of sympathomimetics during during the operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes starting with induction of spinal anesthesia.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative volume of perioperative infused volume during the operation

30 minutes starting with induction of spinal anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration until first application of sympathomimetics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes starting with induction of spinal anesthesia.
secondary_outcome.description: Duration until first administration of any kind of sympathomimetics.

arm_group.description: 120 Patients prior to changes of intern standards of caesarean section. Before march 2017 no patient undergoing elective caesarean section received Granisetron as a matter of routine.
120 Patients after changes of intern standards of caesarean section. After march 2017 all patient undergoing elective caesarean section received Granisetron as a matter of routine.

intervention.description: Patients who did not receive Granisetron.

study_pop.textblock: All patients who underwent spinal anesthesia for caesarean section in out clinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- caesarean section in spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- withdrawal
- incomplete documentation
